metadata.title: CVE-2020-6456 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in clipboard in Google Chromeprior to 81.0.4044.92 allowed a local attacker to bypass site isolation viacrafted clipboard contents.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
